channel.title: Spybot: Search and Destroy - Question
channel.description:
I am sorry if this is in the wrong section.
I have a question, I recently downloaded Spybot Search and Destroy, and I noticed when I ran a check the files that it was checking. There were 386K files it read. My question is, where is it reading these, and is it possible to delete manually some of the files it is reading?
A bit confusing, but any help is appreciated.

item.title: Spybot: Search and Destroy - Question
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Chassy13:

where is it reading these

From your Hard drives?

Uniblue’s Regestry Booster is a helpful tool that cleans your regestry.

Read full topic

item.title: Spybot: Search and Destroy - Question
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I moved it to questions, because this isn’t really related to hardware. I don’t know for sure if it’s supposed to go there or not.

It’ll check your registry files, and go through everything on your hard drive. Spyware often creates files hidden in places such as the system 32 folder, or sometimes it’ll make a random folder with it somewhere else. That’s just one way the spyware is sometimes placed. Right now I have such bad spyware (from a torrent from pirate bay =/) that I have to format. I have done everything possible I swear. I’m not sure about this but there might be a custom scan option, most of these programs do. Just look around the program.

Spybot isn’t that good anymore. It’s good at detecting them, but sucks at removing most modern spyware.

Read full topic
